cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: No heatwave is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 8th for total rainfall with 13.04mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.6mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 7.9 hours.  The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 27.64mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 15.9 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge happened today when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour (ranked first in our records).  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of precipitation fell during that time.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024, characterized by a peak rain intensity of 6.4mm per hour and a total rainfall of 24.56mm.
Weather alert: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 5th longest since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (205°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 78.08 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1604 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 14.6m lower than yesterday, 501.6m lower than the past week, 1604.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 713m and a peak of 1594m, averaging 1052.4m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 5.5°C minimum and 16.2°C maximum, with an average of 15.7°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 13.0°C and 12.3°C.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and near calm conditions. Moderate rainfall, occasional overcast conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather could become unsettled.
